text: Oh
it's baking day and everyday food and
today I have something special for you
it's a coconut pound cake with coconut
on the inside and sprinkled on top for
good measure I have two cups of
all-purpose flour and two that add one
and a half teaspoons of baking powder
half a teaspoon of salt fine salt whisk
together standard operating procedure
when it comes to baking you can use a
sifter for this if you're a sifting type
when you're fully whisked set it aside
just for a sec in your mixer combine one
and a half sticks of butter and one cup
of sugar cream if your butter is really
soft in room temperature it shouldn't
take long especially if you're using an
electric mixer stop and scrape down the
bowl just once or twice to make sure
that everything is fully combined
creaming is one of the most important
parts of making a pound cake because the
creaming and then the adding of the eggs
is what adds a lot of the webinar I only
added one and a half teaspoons of baking
powder which is a little bit low of a
ratio for two cups of flour add a
teaspoon of vanilla
add your eggs one at a time they like to
crack them into a bowl and then add them
into my mixers so I make sure not to get
any eggshell shards when all of your
eggs have been added then you can add
your 1 cup of buttermilk and then your
sifted dry ingredients start adding your
dry ingredients first and keep your
speed on low or turn it off and then
half of your buttermilk
these could be
more buttermilk
and then the remaining flour there we go
scrape all the batter off of your beater
don't leave anything behind
off the mixer you can add your coconut
and I always like to give a nice stir
when I take it off the mixer to make
sure everything from the bottom is fully
combined before you start toast one and
a half cups of coconut this is one and a
quarter and save a quarter for the top
of the cake stir it in so good have your
oven preheating to 350 degrees and
butter and flour and eight and a half by
four and a half inch loaf pan it's a
pretty full cake and it will rise and
dome nicely don't be afraid oh my gosh I
almost left some in there with
completely missing the other side of the
bowl spread it out evenly on top then
you want to bake this until a toothpick
inserted in the very center comes out
clean it'll take about an hour
let your cake cool completely before you
glaze it to make a glaze whisk together
one cup of sifted confectioners sugar
and two tablespoons of buttermilk
because we used buttermilk in the cake I
want to use the same thing for the glaze
and it makes a nice tangy glaze you can
spoon it over the top let it drip down
the sides of course you don't have to
glaze it if you don't want to and
there's plenty of delicious coconut on
the inside but I like to gild the lily
plus it enables me to put a little bit
more coconut on top another quarter cup
of coconut this is the sweetened coconut
let it set before you eat it
once it's set you can cut into it I know
you can wait you just walk away and then
come back an hour later
its moist its coconutty it's a pound
cake you're gonna be making again and
again and again I guarantee it
